quoteFirst: I worked up to twenty knots, and at 9.15 a.m. sighted land ahead and almost immediately the smoke of a ship, which proved to be the H.I.G.M.S. _Emden_ coming out towards me at a great rate. At
quoteLast: fire was opened, she firing the first shot. I kept my distance as much as possible to obtain the advantage of my guns.
title: A Source Book of Australian History
author: Swinburne, Gwendolen H. [Compiler]

quoteFirst: The telephone directory showed that the offices were situated in the Oranien-Straat, about ten minutes’ walk from the hotel, in the business quarter of the city round the Bourse. Robin glanced at the clock. It was
quoteLast: . The principals, he reflected, were not likely to be at the office before ten o’clock. It was a fine morning and he decided to walk.

quoteFirst: It was, then, about
quoteLast: on the night of the fourth of June, eighteen hundred and eighty-six, that, after disposing of a pint of beer and a Welsh rarebit for my supper, I seated myself in my arm-chair, cocked my feet upon a stool, and lit my pipe, as was my custom.

quoteFirst: "Tuesday, July 16, 1907.--Fine day for the first time since July 3. At last we pulled out of Fort Resolution (
quoteLast: ). I never was so thankful to leave a place where every one was kind. I think the maddest cynophile would find a cure here.

quoteFirst: During the night the leaf fell, whereas it ought to have risen; and by 7 A.M. on the following morning it had fallen .23 of an inch, and it continued falling until
quoteLast: It then rose until 10.50 P.M., but the rise was interrupted by one considerable oscillation, that is, by a fall and re-ascent. During the second night it again fell, but only to a very short distance, and on the following morning re-ascended to a very short distance.
title: The Power of Movement in Plants
author: Darwin, Charles, 1809-1882; Darwin, Francis, Sir, 1848-1925

quoteFirst: Fogg invariably arose, to half-past eleven, when he left the house to breakfast at the Reform Club. It comprised everything--the tea and toast at twenty-three minutes past eight, the shaving-water at thirty-seven minutes past nine, and his attendance at his master's toilet at
quoteLast: , and so on. Then from half-past eleven a.m. until midnight, when the methodical Fogg retired to bed, everything was noted down and arranged for. Passe-partout joyfully set himself to study the programme and to master its contents.
title: Round the World in Eighty Days
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905; Frith, Henry, 1840- [Translator]

quoteFirst: "At about
quoteLast: two squadrons of the 9th Bengal Cavalry were detached by Colonel Ewart, commanding Cavalry Brigade, to pursue the enemy, who, driven from the Hill Dihilibat by the Berkshire Regiment, were retiring south in the direction of Tamaai. Colonel Ewart ordered two squadrons to dismount and fire volleys.

quoteFirst: He had good hunting. At
quoteLast: he stopped the _Walter Leonhardt_, from Lulea to Hamburg, with iron ore. The crew abandoned ship, and were picked up by a Swedish steamer, considerately stopped for the purpose. A gun-cotton charge then sent the empty vessel to the bottom.

quoteFirst: Why had he spoken of Viola? And then, in the flight of fancies which surged through his mind, there was one that he stayed and detained. It was that he must see her again before she left town. He looked at his watch: it lacked
quoteLast: , and on the impulse of the moment he hailed a passing 'bus. It was inexplicable to him that the night before she should have let him go without a word as to her movements.

quoteFirst: A few, but only a few, go south; two or three go west, or to right of me. I do not speak of the north, against which I act as a screen. All told, the great majority take the left, that is to say, the direction of the nest. The last is released at
quoteLast: . One of the fifty travellers has lost her mark in the paper bag. I deduct her from the total, leaving forty-nine.

quoteFirst: Lord Kitchener now threw himself into the task of concentrating and organising a relieving Army. He telegraphed at
quoteLast: on October 3 asking the French War Minister to make all preparations to send the proposed two divisions with cavalry and artillery complete as soon as possible and to let him know how soon they could be dispatched. He was asked in reply whether he would prefer one Territorial Division with a complete brigade of _Fusiliers Marins_.
title: The World Crisis, Volume 1 (of 6)
author: Churchill, Winston, 1874-1965

quoteLast: , we reached Marseilles at nearly midnight, feeling very tired, and were glad to get to the Terminus Hotel, which is comfortably close to the station. What a charming station it is, with its courtyard and garden, orange trees and flowering myrtles!
